content.description: Slab directly beneath Mangler/Monster. Go up the myriad of crimps and jugs to top. Fun way to get up to Mangler.
content.protection: Pads and a real good spotter

content.description: Start in hueco below wave flake. Climb up and left along horizontal crack to top out on top left of boulder.
content.location: Look for the boulder to the left of Marietta Mangler. Has large flake in the middle shaped like a wave.

content.description: Start on hueco below wave flake. Go up to wave and then straight up on sidepulls and a sloppy southern top out.
Start on large flat ledge and go up on flat ledges to an easy mantle top.
content.location: Far left boulder at mangler area. Boulder is to the left of do you even jam?

content.description: Start on right side of block below Marietta Maiden. Work around to the left and top out along little shredder.
content.location: Between marrietta maiden and little shredder.

content.description: Start with feet on a detachted block. Make one precise move, and the rest is fun pulls on good holds!
Great pocket and undercling with terrible feet make the start mantle-out the top.

This short boulder sit-starts with two power moves to the lip. Fairly consistent difficulty for all the moves makes this short boulder full value. Start on a 4ft arete below the roof, pull over using crimps, and stab out to pockets for the top.
content.location: This route is on the wall just left of “Surfs Up Traverse”.

content.description: This problem starts on the same jug hold as the Mangler, but instead of traversing to the left, it follows the seam in the rock-face upwards and tops out over the lip. It is currently an open Project.
content.protection: Crash Pad and probably a spotter or two.
content.location: This problem is located on the same rock face that the Marietta Mangler is on.

content.description: Start on jugs rail. Move up to a blind left hand around the aréte. Mantle top.
Start same as Marietta Mangler. Traverse right and then up crimps to chossy crimps and pinches. Sketchy mantle top.

This problem traverses across an overhanging rock face. The route starts on a jug hold at the far right hand side and follows a thin crack to the left across the face. The moves are reachy and the holds are mostly crimps.
content.location: The problem can be found at the top of the second group of rock formations (the main area). The river has many rapids here and the area is much more open than the first rock formation.

content.description: Start far left of Marietta Mangler in wet crack. Climb up and slightly right on side pulls and crimps. Recommend top on good jug and drop to pad. Top out is sketchy and covered in plants.
content.protection: Pads are fine. Watch for extruding rock on left.
content.location: Far left of Marietta Mangler in crack.

content.description: Sharp, skin ripping, and short. This is the first route to the left of the Marrietta Mangler Wall. Sit start with a good crimp on the left, then move through heel hooks and sharp edges and rock-over to top out.
Start with feet on wet ramp and hands on flat ledge. Go up on good ledges and crimps to a classic southern sloppy top.
content.location: Boulder is left of do you even jam? Start on middle of Boulder.

content.description:
Start far left where the wet jug is in the corner and take the lowest line all the way right to the very end where the jugs are (start of marietta monster/mangler). Did not top out (Top out still an open project for me, Selah V10). 

 Route consists of several difficult crosses, several feet first sequences, and a short and pumpy campus crux towards the very end.

 This route is Marietta Mangler, backwards.
content.location: Big roof past the bamboo forest

content.description: Starting from an underclinging, deep, left, finger-jam cross up to crimps. Follow holds in and around the crack straight up. The crux is bearing down on the crimps at the lip to get to the good holds above.
content.location: Just left of Surfs Up Traverse directly next to Mossy Mess.

content.description: Start in hole below wave flake and make a big move to block on lip. Move right onto the large flake on top and struggle to the side pull crack on the same flake to top out.
content.location: On Wave Boulder to the left of Marietta Mangler

content.description: Cliff line and small boulders directly across the river from Chattahoochee Coffee Company. Includes the classics Marietta Mangler and Monster.
